programme.title: Insane Pools: Off the Deep End

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: A celebration of the enduring success of the childrens TV classic. Originally created in Paris in the early 1960s by French animator Serge Danot, the plots were a million miles away from the series that English actor Eric Thompson and animator Ivor Wood rescripted, revoiced and reinterpreted for a British audience

programme.title: The Magic Roundabout
programme.desc: Florence and Brian help Dougal search for a four-leaf clover. A 1968 episode of the classic childrens programme, narrated by Eric Thompson

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James is intrigued after meeting a cowhand, and Mr Dawson disturbs Siegfried. Rural drama about a North Yorkshire vet, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Brian Glover

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: The vets are saddened by the death of George VI, especially as it coincides with the passing away of Mr Potts. Meanwhile, Siegfried decides to help Calum and Deirdre patch things up. Veterinary drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: The Intruder
programme.desc: Paula is arrested on suspicion of murder, and Jerôme decides he wants a divorce after discovering some long-held secrets, while Tess continues to weave her web in the family home. French psychological thriller, starring Melanie Doutey

programme.title: The Intruder
programme.desc: Paula locates the places where Tess grew up and begins to realise that she is probably not who she says she is and that she did not target the Martel family by chance. Meanwhile, Camilles unease is growing as Tess takes advantage of Paulas absence to try and consolidate her position in the family. French psychological thriller, starring Melanie Doutey

programme.title: Parkinson
programme.sub-title: With Patricia Routledge, Morgan Freeman and Gary Lineker
programme.desc: An edition of the talk show from 1998, with actress Patricia Routledge, actor Morgan Freeman and sports presenter Gary Lineker joining Michael Parkinson

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom and Barbara apply their creative talents when they try to make clothes out of nettles and wool, while Jerry has his eye on becoming the next managing director of JJM. Comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Penelope Keith and Paul Eddington

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Jim Hacker prepares to make his first public broadcast as prime minister, but finds it is not so easy to speak to camera as he imagined. John Wells guest stars, alongside Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James is intrigued after meeting a cowhand, and Mr Dawson disturbs Siegfried. Rural drama about a North Yorkshire vet, starring Christopher Timothy, Robert Hardy and Brian Glover

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: The vets are saddened by the death of George VI, especially as it coincides with the passing away of Mr Potts. Meanwhile, Siegfried decides to help Calum and Deirdre patch things up. Veterinary drama, starring Christopher Timothy and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Wildlife on One
programme.sub-title: African Penguin: Cool Bird in a Hot Spot
programme.desc: The invasion of Cape Town by penguins in 1984 paved the way for others to breed on the African mainland, despite the blazing sunshine and human presence. David Attenborough reveals the interdependence of these birds, which choose a new home each year on the offshore islands or in town

programme.title: Jane Goodall: Beauty and the Beasts
programme.desc: In 1960, a young secretary from Bournemouth, with no scientific qualifications, entered a remote forest in Africa and achieved something nobody else had ever done before. Jane Goodall became accepted by a group of wild chimpanzees, making discoveries that transformed the understanding of humans closest relatives. This programme reveals the person behind the myth, looking at what motivates her and the personal cost her lifes work has exacted from her

programme.title: Wogan
programme.sub-title: Jane Goodall, Ade Edmondson and Eurythmics
programme.desc: Terry Wogan chats to conservationist Jane Goodall and comedian Ade Edmondson, and presents music by the Eurythmic. Plus, an interview via satellite with Parker from Thunderbirds. First broadcast in 1986

programme.title: A Choral Pilgrimage with the Sixteen
programme.desc: Hannah French presents a concert from Peterborough Cathedral, with Harry Christophers conducting choral ensemble the Sixteen in music from across nine centuries. Featuring choral music on the theme of peace by Hildegard of Bingen, Anna Clyne, John Taverner, Will Todd and Arvo Part

programme.title: Lord Mervyn King Remembers - The Age of Uncertainty
programme.desc: The former governor of the Bank of Englandlooks back on the BBCs 1977 series on the history of economic thinking, which was written and presented by the highly influential economist and intellectual John Kenneth Galbraith. The series tackled the challenge of bringing economics to a mainstream audience, seemingly sparing no expense in its use of actors, elaborate sets and multiple international locations. Lord King gives an assessment of the series five decades on from its original transmission, sharing his opinion of Galbraith and his methods, and explaining why the series divided critics at the time

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.sub-title: The Prophets and Promise of Classical Capitalism
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith looks at the history of economic thinking, beginning with the men who laid the foundations, including Adam Smith, David Ricardo and Thomas Malthus. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: The Age of Uncertainty
programme.sub-title: The Manners and Morals of High Capitalism
programme.desc: John Kenneth Galbraith looks at the ideas that sustained the rich in the 19th century and how they still affected attitudes in the 1970s. First broadcast in 1977

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Appealing to both adults and children alike, Philip Pullmans books have sold more than 20 million copies and been translated into 40 languages, with his recent novel La Belle Sauvage becoming an instant best-seller. Alan Yentob spends time with the author in Oxford, discovering how the former teacher became an acclaimed writer of fantasy fiction - and an outspoken critic of organised religion

programme.title: A Choral Pilgrimage with the Sixteen
programme.desc: Hannah French presents a concert from Peterborough Cathedral, with Harry Christophers conducting choral ensemble the Sixteen in music from across nine centuries. Featuring choral music on the theme of peace by Hildegard of Bingen, Anna Clyne, John Taverner, Will Todd and Arvo Part

This programme reveals the person behind the myth, looking at what motivates her and the personal cost her lifes work has exacted from her

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the King Harry ferry to enjoy a crossing voted one of the most scenic in the world, rustles up a vegetarian tart and investigates the Cornish influence on Oscar-Winning composer Malcolm Arnold with Radio 3 presenter Petroc Trelawny

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton visits the spectacular Perth and Kinross countryside, on a mission to help a young couple from Edinburgh realise their dream of a new lifestyle in a rural home

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Rafi has been left with brain damage after suddenly falling seriously ill. After spending a year in hospital, he has finally returned home only for it to become apparent the house is not equipped to meet his complex needs. At risk of returning to a medical setting, Rafis loved ones are desperate to keep him by their side, where his recovery has already shown remarkable progress. They turn to Nick Knowles and the team for urgent help to transform their home into a safe haven that will give Rafi the chance to thrive and keep the family together

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.sub-title: Countryfile Ramble for BBC Children in Need 2025
programme.desc: Matt Baker, Anita Rani, Sean Fletcher, Joe Crowley and John Craven lace up their walking boots and explore the border of Shropshire and Staffordshire, hearing the stories of young people whose lives have been positively impacted by Children in Need along the way

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: After the excitement of movie week, the remaining couples show off another routine in a bid to impress judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke, as well as the viewers, in the hope of avoiding the fate of last weeks eliminated couple Ross King and Jowita Przystal. Several couples have impressed in the opening weeks, but know they are only one poor dance away from slipping down the leaderboard. Presented by Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Eight celebrities who were voted off first in previous episodes are given a chance to redeem themselves and win £50,000 for charity. Susie McCabe, Joel Corry, Tim Vine, Konan, Donna Preston, Helen Flanagan, Linda Robson and Danny John-Jules take part. Romesh Ranganathan hosts

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: The deadly secret hidden in Flight CBZ517 is discovered, but it still doesnt explain the murders or help the survivors escape. The passengers believe they have found the traitor in the group, but are they right?

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Crystal Palace v Bournemouth at Selhurst Park, and Sunderland v Wolverhampton Wanderers at The Stadium of Light. Both of last seasons matches between the Eagles and Cherries finished in 0-0 draws, but with both teams getting off to a flying start in this campaign a more exciting match was anticipated. The Black Cats and Wolves were meeting in the top flight for the first time since the 2011/12 season, and the hosts were aiming to continue their excellent early-season form against their struggling visitors. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Chelsea, Brighton and Hove Albion v Newcastle United, Burnley v Leeds United, Manchester City v Everton, and Fulham v Arsenal

Plus, a report on a conference discussing how to rebuild faith relationships in the UK, and a celebration of Diwali with some traditional dancing and music

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.desc: Friday evening Isha prayers from the Belfast Islamic Centre, the final of the five daily prayers in Islam. They take place after sunset, providing an opportunity for worshippers to reflect on their day and look ahead to the future

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Pam Rhodes celebrates the 1,700-year anniversary of the Nicene Creed and explores why this ancient declaration of beliefs is so important in the history of Christianity. At the Coptic Orthodox Church Centre in Stevenage, Pam unpacks the background and impact of the Nicene Creed with Anba Angaelos, archbishop of the Coptic Orthodox Church, The Roman Catholic archbishop of Birmingham, Bernard Longley, and the former archbishop of Canterbury, Rowan Williams. With each representing a very different branch of the Church, they explore why the creed is such a powerful symbol of Christian Unity

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Richard Clifford presents this months Lifeline appeal on behalf of React, a charity dedicated to helping children with life shortening illnesses by providing specialist equipment and respite breaks for them and their families

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of marine life in different environments around the world

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin reveals hidden wildlife gems from across the British Isles. In the spring, he encounters badgers, adders and nightingales. Hamza also heads to the Wirral to try and film one of the weirdest events in Britain. A high spring tide forces small mammals to leave their homes in the marsh and head to higher ground, providing a frenzy for a range of predators

programme.title: A Shaun the Sheep Movie: Farmageddon
programme.desc: When an alien with amazing powers crash-lands near Mossy Bottom Farm, Shaun the Sheep goes on a mission to shepherd the intergalactic visitor home before a sinister organisation can capture her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Justin Fletcher, John Sparkes and Amalia Vitale

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith, Matt Baker and Adam Henson are in Kent to explore the influence of France on the Garden of England as the Kent Downs National Landscape is on the verge of making history as part of what could become the worlds first UNESCO Cross-Channel Geopark, a unique project that would celebrate the geological and cultural links between Kent and northern France. Matt visits a Kentish vineyard and Charlotte heads to a wildlife reserve thats been created using the spoil from the Channel Tunnel excavation. Adam meets a farmer who raises French Charolais cattle

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: Hamza Yassin records wildlife around the UK during summer, travelling from the vast open ocean of the Irish sea to the heart of Leeds and his remote home on Scotlands west coast. Along the way, he encounters a two-metre long blue shark, pregnant greater horseshoe bats, a pod of common dolphins, and wild beavers, which have been missing from Britain for the past 400 years

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman announce the results of the judges scores and viewers votes, with the two couples with the lowest combined scores taking part in a dance-off to decide who will be next to leave the contest. Plus, music by Leigh-Anne Pinnock and the professionals perform a fierce group tango

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from the National Waterfront Museum in Swansea, where highlights include a rare, 19th-century photograph album capturing landmarks of Ancient Egypt and an Elton John signature brought in by one of the singers proteges. Fiona also explores Wales industrial and maritime heritage, visiting a collection charting Swanseas evolution from copper production through local coal mining to the early days of steam trains

programme.title: Riot Women
programme.desc: As Beth and Kitty become the Lennon and McCartney of the Riot Women, Jesss feud with rival Hebden bar owner Inez reignites. Nisha grapples with a toxic colleague, and Holly realises her mothers dementia is worsening. A high-octane first band rehearsal gives way to common ground, but as the women start to bond, a long-buried secret smacks Kitty in the face

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Tottenham Hotspur v Aston Villa at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, and Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield. Spurs battled back from a goal down to record a 4-1 victory in the corresponding clash against Villa last term, with Dominic Solanke bagging a second-half brace. Meanwhile, the Reds were looking for a first home win over the Red Devils since the 2022/23 season when they triumphed 7-0, with the two meetings since then ending in draws. Plus, a recap of the goals and talking points from Saturday

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Rock legend Bruce Springsteen and The Bear star Jeremy Allen White, who plays Bruce in Springsteen: Deliver Me from Nowhere join the host to discuss the biographical movie. Oscar-winner Jennifer Lawrence discusses her role in psychological drama Die My Love and Tessa Thompson reflects on taking the lead in Hedda, a bold re-imagining of Ibsens Hedda Gabler. Plus, Florence + the Machine perform the new single Everybody Scream

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: Larger than life and fun loving TikTok star Akafi battles with his insecure inner voice, which is hellbent on destroying his self-confidence as he gets ready for a date

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Five years in the future, Amy has put her adventures with the Doctor behind her and is about to become a mother. The Time Lord returns and leaves her facing a heart-breaking choice that will change her life for ever. Toby Jones guest stars alongside Karen Gillan and Matt Smith, in an episode written by Men Behaving Badly creator Simon Nye

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part one of two. An ambitious project to drill into the Earth disturbs something underground. As Amy learns she cannot trust even the ground under her feet, it becomes clear that while humans were digging down, another species was on its way up, and an old foe of the Doctors is poised to reclaim a world they believe is theirs by right. Meera Syal, Neve McIntosh and Robert Pugh guest star alongside Matt Smith and Karen Gillan

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryns decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: The Shipmans drive to Wales for the wedding fayre, and after a momentous trip to the church for the reading of the banns, Nessa tells Stacey her big secret. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne and Joanna Page

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: Actress Jane Horrocks joins the judging panel as Mama Ru tests the queens overacting skills with a series of scripts that pay homage to the UKs famous legacy of bonk-buster fiction. In uncanny timing, Jane, famed for playing the part of hapless PA Bubble in Absolutely Fabulous, is on hand to give her thoughts on a very special Ab Fab runway in A Night of a Thousand Sweetie Darlings. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr complete the judging panel as the queens once again fight for a much-coveted RuPeter badge and survival

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared, and as they reminisce, old feelings resurface. Maurice and Funmis romantic night out falls apart when they cant find a babysitter, forcing them to improvise at home - quietly, cautiously, and with one ear on the baby monitor. Over dinner, Errol finally works up the courage to ask Grace a big question - until Claude and Polly swoop in and ruin the mood. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit to the set of Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows its his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. A flawless day could launch his career, but as one mishap spirals into another, he must rely on his charm and determination to keep the production afloat - and his dream within reach. When Maurice misses yet another nursery event for Mayowa, Funmi finds an unexpected ally in a fellow parent. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena faces one final obstacle - he needs Simons help. Needless to say, getting his support comes with big strings attached. A run-in with Vanessa and her new boyfriend hits Kwabena like a ton of bricks. Maurice is blindsided when he learns that Mayowa has a girlfriend - something he knew nothing about. The revelation stings, forcing him to ask if the sacrifices hes making to fund his sons future are costing him the present. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: The conflicts between the group conspire to ruin Janet and Jonnys hen and stag parties. The plan for a quiet baby shower rather than a raucous girls night out goes awry, as Donna refuses to come and Louise is desperate to let her hair down before she gets sent to jail

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps

He realizes that the Lemmings are making some themselves! / Inspired by a jewelry ad showing a man offering a diamond to a woman, Grizzy imagines himself offering the rangers engagement ring to his she-bear. / When he accidentally sticks a computer microprocessor to his temple, Grizzy is transformed into an exceptionally intelligent being. / The Lemmings prepare a dream afternoon snack with the last jar of chocolate spread in the cupboard. Tough luck Grizzy is coming! / Grizzy finds he can print images from the rangers camera. / A crate of jars of chocolate spread is delivered. / As usual Grizzy picks the door of the Rangers log cabin to come in and make himself comfortable but this time its impossible to enter! / The Lemmings have got hold of beans with strange properties. / Grizzy wants to get rid of the old piano at any cost.

But Chep promises that this time he won’t. / Mushpie loves to sing. Only problem she is terrible at it! But Lilit, who has never heard her sing before, wants to make Mushpie happy and organizes a concert for her to sing.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Theyre soon smiling when Brittany lays on an arty afternoon, though faces drop when it comes to the cost

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Its been a fiery week, and every last one of the BandBers is unhappy with their feedback - especially considering barely anyone has said they would like to return to one anothers establishments. Fireworks seem in prospect as they meet up one last time to go over their scores and find out whos won

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: A couple attempt to combine an army lorry and an old caravan to create the ultimate off-roader, and a man returns to his familys farm to build a luxury cabin. Meanwhile, George visits a building in Denmark that was designed to be a work of art and an office, checks out a skip thats been turned into a home, and takes inspiration for his scissor lift cabin from a stunning 18th-century bridge

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of discerning house-hunters, each with very strong ideas on what they wanted. The searches may have been tough - in some instances they didnt even make it inside some of the properties - but both have faced even more challenging times since. In 2012, couple Robin and Colin wanted to move outside of London, but only an architectural gem was going to do. In 2014, Lia and Andrew said they were done renting in Londons popular Isle of Dogs, and wanted to buy their own home now they were starting a family

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help Amy and Brian from Newtownards, Northern Ireland decide whether to move or renovate their five-bedroom chalet bungalow. After 50 years in the same house, Brian has had enough and wants a more spacious home in the countryside with more storage for his hobbies. Kirstie comes up with a plan to make their existing home feel brand new while Phil heads out to find a future-proof property with accessible ground floor accommodation to suit Brians health needs

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to Gloucestershire to visit Jon and Noreen who, in 2013, planned to build a three-bed treehouse on a half-acre patch of woodland. Their stacked three box design was to be almost gravity-defying to avoid harming any tree roots and a mirror glass ground floor to reflect the surrounding trees but their £250,000 budget didnt seem to match the projects high ambition. Despite having worked hands-on for long hours with help from friends and family, by 2016 the house was barely ready enough for them to move in and the money had run out with the project not finished. Seven years later, Kevin returns to see their progress

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Bettany Hughes Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany Hughes uncovers Uzbekistans rich historical treasures. Near Termez, she traces Alexander the Great and examines how his story became a network of religious exchange. In the countrys north west, she explores the ancient kingdom of Chorasmia, and discovers Zoroastrian funerary practices, sun-worship and exciting new finds. She traces the Sogdians, merchants at the heart of the silk road. New finds in Bukhara reveal the worlds first pack camel statuette, and murals in Afrasiab show rising Sogdian ambitions. In Samarkand, Bettany unravels the story of the women behind Emperor Timur

programme.title: Great British Train Journeys from Above
programme.desc: The Ffestiniog Railway carves a path through the towering peaks of Eryri, one of Britains most enchanting mountain ranges and changed the course of Welsh history. Travelling from the harbour town of Porthmadog to the historic slate mines at Blaenau Ffestiniog, Hugh Bonneville explores how the railways transformed a quiet corner of rural Wales into a global industrial powerhouse

programme.title: The Menu
programme.desc: A wealthy fine dining aficionado and his unimpressed girlfriend are among the guests at a dinner party overseen by a celebrity chef. As the meal unfolds over several courses, it becomes apparent that their host has sinister plans for all in attendance. Comedy thriller, starring Ralph Fiennes, Anya Taylor-Joy, Nicholas Hoult, Hong Chau and Janet McTeer

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: The story of the Battle of Midway, a clash between the American fleet and the Imperial Japanese Navy, which marked a pivotal turning point in the Pacific Theatre during the Second World War. When US intelligence intercepts messages detailing a Japanese attack on an unnamed location, it becomes a race against time to both figure out where will be hit next and how to prepare for an impending battle. Roland Emmerichs drama, starring Ed Skrein, Patrick Wilson, Woody Harrelson and Luke Evans

programme.title: Dinosaur with Stephen Fry
programme.desc: The actor and writer is magically transported back in time to chart the 180-million-year story of the prehistoric creatures, beginning by going back 155 million years to the Jurassic period. He explores the conifer forests and fern prairies that were their home, encountering a monstrous plant-eating diplodocus and deadly predator the allosaurus. Expert Susie Maidment arrives to decode these dinosaurs remarkable behaviour, including the diplodocuss acrobatic ability to rear up on its hind legs and the allosauruss terrifying attack strategy

programme.title: Dinosaur with Stephen Fry
programme.desc: The actor examines the early Cretaceous period, an era that saw an explosion in dinosaur diversity 125 million years ago. In a vast and sandy virtual river valley, he sets off in search of the fearsome velociraptor, only to find that this dreaded dinosaur made famous in the Jurassic Park films was in reality no bigger than a turkey. Stephen is joined by expert Dr Dean Lomax to observe the remarkable behaviour of this highly intelligent predator, before heading to the US to meet the dinosaur hunter who first discovered the Utahraptor

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley: Funniest Moments
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating Richard Curtiss much-loved sitcom, featuring clips along with insight and analysis from cast, crew and celebrity fans. The programme examines how the fictional village of Dibley was never the same once Dawn Frenchs inimitable comedy creation Geraldine Granger arrived as the new vicar, and there is a look at the Comic Relief specials

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: National and international news

programme.title: Beast from the East: The Big Freeze of 2018
programme.desc: Britain was chilled to the bone by a brutal Siberian weather system in 2018 that lasted for 10 days from February 26 and saw temperatures plunge to -10C. This documentary uses news archive, video footage and interviews with celebrities to reflect on this extreme weather event, featuring contributions from actress Laila Morse, MasterChef host Gregg Wallace, Countryfiles Adam Henson and BBC meteorologist Tomasz Schafernaker

programme.title: Prince Edward: The Reliable Royal
programme.desc: Documentary looking back at the life of the Kings youngest brother, who grew up vilified by the press but has become a cornerstone of the monarchy. Things began to turn bad for the young royal when, only four months into his Royal Marines training course, news emerged he wanted out. And when he started a media career, first as a production assistant at Andrew Lloyd Webbers theatre company, then with his ill-advised Its a Royal Knockout, he became something of a laughingstock. But in later years, with his marriage to Sophie, fatherhood and greater attention to his royal duties, he has become much loved by the public

programme.title: Royal Heirs and Spares: Rivalry and Resentment
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the rivalries between royal heirs and their siblings, tracing the evolving dynamic between those born into unequal destinies from the early 20th century to today. The programme examines the tensions loyalties and comparisons that have defined these relationships, with the well-documented issues between Prince William and Prince Harry bringing the Heir and Spare dynamic into the digital age. Featuring interviews with royal historians, commentators and those who have worked behind palace walls, the film offers fresh insights into how these rivalries have shaped both the individuals involved and the public perception of the monarchy

programme.title: Exclusive: Prince Andrew and the Epstein Email Scandal
programme.desc: Documentary examining the recent revelation about a messsage sent from Prince Andrew to Jeffrey Epstein long after he claimed to have cut ties with the convicted sex offender. Featuring an interview with Daphne Barak, who wrote the article exposing the email in the Mail on Sunday, as well as journalists Nick Payne and Amy Jones

programme.title: The 1970s: Those Were the Days
programme.desc: First of a two-part documentary looking back at what it was like living through the early 1970s in Britain, featuring news stories, fads, fashions and essential items of the decade. The programme covers everything from Marc Bolan and David Bowie establishing the new era of glam rock to kids obsessing over toys and transport like Clackers, Choppers and space hoppers. With contributions from Shaun Ryder, Anneka Rice, Anthea Turner, Wayne Sleep, Courtney Pine, Charlie Higson, Zoe Lyons and Samira Ahmed

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Alex Langlands investigate the Pendle Witch trials of 1612. The presenters visit Lancaster Castle, where the suspects were held, read James Is infamous book on demons, and talk to archaeologists who claim to have found the site of the supposed covens meeting place. Plus, a look at the role a nine-year-old girl played in sealing the fates of the accused women and how the trial influenced British legal history

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Alex Langlands visit Sherwood Forest to learn more about the legend of Robin Hood - who may or may not have been real - and King John, who definitely was. An archaeological team digs the land surrounding the ruins of King Johns palace at Clipstone in the heart of the forest, hoping to reveal how far the royal buildings stretched. Helen and Alex also visit several of Robin Hoods supposed hideouts, as well as Nottingham Castle, where he is reputed to have been imprisoned before escaping via a secret tunnel

programme.title: Live: NFL Big Game Day
programme.desc: Jacksonville Jaguars v Los Angeles Rams (Kick-off 2.30pm). Nat Coombs is joined by Osi Umenyiora to present coverage of the week seven match at Wembley Stadium. These two sides have met just six times over the years with the Rams winning five of those matches. The last time the Jaguars beat their visitors was in an over-time victory back in 2009 when the Rams were based in St Louis, as the hosts claimed a 23-20 win. With reports by Ellie Evelyn and Troy Hawke

programme.title: Live: NFL Big Game Night
programme.desc: Kansas City Chiefs v Las Vegas Raiders (Kick-off 6.00pm). Dermot OLeary is joined by Sam Quek, and Osi Umenyiora to present coverage of the week seven match, which takes place at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri. The Chiefs prevailed in both matches against their divisional rivals last season, including a 19-17 victory here that relied on a fourth-quarter field goal from Matthew Wright to spare their blushes and avoid a narrow defeat. Tonights coverage will also feature the game within a game quiz element, whenever the NFL game stops in the US

programme.title: The Greatest TV of the...

programme.title: Fawlty Towers: A Very British Comedy
programme.desc: Created by John Cleese and Connie Booth, Fawlty Towers reached heights of popularity few shows at the time could rival. So, why does it only exist in a recut, sanitised and edited form, with some of the original scenes deleted? This programme looks at controversies surrounding the classic comedy, examining its sometimes uncomfortable place in the modern world, using deleted scenes and archival interviews to piece together the story of how a sitcom that seemed untouchable in the 1970s came to be viewed through a more critical lens

programme.title: Before They Were Royal
programme.desc: Documentary looking at the Duke of Edinburghs early life, his playboy father and troubled mother, and an immediate childhood connection that blossomed into a royal romance. Experts and insiders reveal his achievements in the face of danger as a sailor in the Second World War, and the extraordinary experience of fighting against his aristocratic German brothers-in-law. The programme also explores the extent of the sacrifices he made to marry Princess Elizabeth in 1947, giving up his Mediterranean titles, becoming a naturalised British citizen and devoting his life to the service of the crown, always in deference to his wife

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride

Now its down to Gordon to motivate Natalie and save Michons from disaster

Maggie is put off by the soup and Tina isnt a fan of the lamb rump main, but its Marcs low energy and seriousness that concerns the guests most of all

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: Homer is forced to eat bland food after he burns his taste buds while trying to copy a fire-eating street performer. programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA

Owners Richard and Jorges in-fighting has alienated locals, and the duos suggestion that customer numbers are low because of racism has heightened tensions

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The final newlyweds embark on their honeymoons, and while one couple realise that physical intimacy doesnt always lead to a deeper connection, another pair are pushed to breaking point by one partners constant need for reassurance. programme.title: Married at First Sight UK

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK

Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the childrens books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Girls Just Want to Have Sums
programme.desc: A scandal results in Principal Skinner being replaced by a woman who divides the school in half according to gender, so Lisa poses as a boy to attend maths classes. However, it is not long before she comes to the attention of Bart - who sees through her disguise. With the voice of Frances McDormand

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge and Homer rent an apartment in an affluent area so their children can have a good education when Springfield Elementary is rated the worst school in the state. Bart wastes no time in establishing a bad-boy persona, and increases Lisas popularity by telling people she knows a pop star. With the voice of Elliot Page (Juno)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: I Wont Be Home for Christmas
programme.desc: Homer gets into the spirit of the season during a Christmas Eve session at Moes, and after getting a tad too merry he is told not to come home by an angry Marge. Wandering around Springfield all on his own, the lovable oaf is left to think about his actions - but will he see the error of his ways?

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Man Who Came to Be Dinner
programme.desc: Homer and Marge take the kids to Diz-Nee Land, where they soon become exasperated by the amusement parks lengthy queues, until they discover a ride that transports them to the home planet of Kang and Kodos

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Its the much-anticipated Love/Hate Week, as the experts push the couples to reveal their biggest likes and dislikes about each other. While some bonds grow stronger and feelings are shared, emotions boil over when one groom reaches breaking point after hearing his wifes critiques

programme.title: MAFS UK: Its Official!
programme.sub-title: Mafs Uk: Its Official! With Lucinda Light
programme.desc: Lucindas joined by actor, comedian and writer Donna Preston. Its the midpoint in the experiment and with just three commitment ceremonies left, its make-or-break for some of our couples. Also, bride Leah pops by to talk about married life and causing chaos in the apartments

programme.title: Virgin Island
programme.desc: The fifth phase of the course takes the group into unchartered waters, with lessons on how to achieve an orgasm. Emma has never masturbated before and has no idea what an orgasm feels like. Taylor and Jason are both looking for a first of their own, admitting theyve never had a meaningful kiss. Pia discovers more about her body, and Zac finds out the hard way that sex can be a complicated business

programme.title: Oblivion
programme.desc: A repairman is assigned to salvage the remaining resources from Earth, which has been left a devastated wasteland after a war with an alien race. He discovers a human survivor on the surface of the planet, an encounter that exposes secrets from the past that threaten the future of the human race. Sci-fi adventure, starring Tom Cruise and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Its the much-anticipated Love/Hate Week, as the experts push the couples to reveal their biggest likes and dislikes about each other. While some bonds grow stronger and feelings are shared, emotions boil over when one groom reaches breaking point after hearing his wifes critiques

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht
programme.desc: Captain Glenns shocked to see what his crew did to the boat during their night off, and he doesnt let anyone off the hook. At a beach club, romance sparks for multiple crew members, creating a cocktail of jealousy and drama. When a familiar face rejoins the crew, Gary and Daisy try co-habiting, while the rest of the stews enter a showdown for the new crew members attention

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Malcolm and Marty come to the rescue when Dave and Gemmas elaborate plans for Grovers birthday party go awry, but Calvins choice of gift sends one person to the hospital

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Tony and Dianes wedding is fast approaching, but Tonys got plenty of distractions to work his way through first, including pacifying a demanding Marie and a nostalgia-filled stag do. Meanwhile, love is in the air for one iconic couple, and Darrens bad decisions lead him into an underworld of secrets and danger

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of natures evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the vision in squid and owls, which have both developed incredible adaptations to help them navigate at night

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at animals that rely on other species, from cuckoos planting their eggs in other birds nests to the deaths-head hawkmoth stealing honey

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough takes a look at gorillas and vampire bats, two species that have unfairly gained unpleasant reputation within the animal kingdom

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The veteran naturalist reflects on the remarkable abilities that some plants and animals possess, such as the electric eel that helped inspire the battery and flowers that talk to bees using electrical signals

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines the emperor penguin and the wood frog, both of which survive in conditions so cold they seem to defy the laws of nature. The emperor is the only penguin able to breed on Antarctic sea ice during winter, while the wood frog can survive up to 65 per cent of its body mass freezing during its hibernation

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines creatures that spin and weave, contemplating the history of silk production and its romantic origins in China

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Guided by his Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel, Michael Portillo embarks on a rail journey from Amritsar to Shimla. Along the way he helps to feed people at the worlds largest free kitchen, and travels the railway routes used by millions of migrants during Partition. Beginning in the Sikh holy city, Michael is dazzled by the beauty of the Golden Temple and awed by the scale of its langar - the worlds largest free kitchen. His route then takes him through the Punjab, and at Kalka, Michael glimpses the Himalayas for the first time

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Jodhpur to Delhi, heading into the desert to take a camel ride to a village where life has changed little in centuries, before embarking on the Jaipur-Agra-Delhi Golden Triangle tour - Indias must-do itinerary in 1913 as today. Michael also visits Agra, where he learns how the Taj Mahal, built by a Mughal emperor, was restored by a British viceroy at the time of his Bradshaws guide book

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about the making of the Cold War espionage drama

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: A family of four-inch-high people living beneath the floorboards of an ordinary human home help the owners son fight back when a dastardly lawyer plans to demolish the house and make way for a luxury apartment block. Childrens fantasy, starring John Goodman, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, Flora Newbigin and Tom Felton

programme.title: Babe: Pig in the City
programme.desc: The pig and his farmyard pals take a trip to the big city, where their curiosity and love of adventure lands them in trouble, leaving the courageous Babe to find a way to save his chums from danger. Family comedy sequel, starring Magda Szubanski, Mickey Rooney and James Cromwell, and featuring the voice of Elizabeth Daily as Babe

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood
programme.desc: In 1998, magazine journalist Lloyd Vogel is sent to interview beloved TV entertainer Fred Rogers, an assignment he feels is beneath him. However, a friendship soon forms between the two men. Director Marielle Hellers drama based on a true story, starring an Oscar and Bafta-nominated Tom Hanks, Matthew Rhys and Chris Cooper

programme.title: Bumblebee
programme.desc: In 1987, lonely Californian teenager Charlie Watson is traumatised by the death of her father and resentful of her mother Sallys relationship with new boyfriend Ronald. For her 18th-birthday shes given a yellow Volkswagen Beetle, which turns out to be the battle-scarred Autobot Bumblebee. Transformers prequel, starring Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Jorge Lendeborg Jr

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: In the 11th century, a group of Europeans set out for China to discover how to make gunpowder. However, on arrival their claims to be on a trading mission are disbelieved and they are arrested and imprisoned by the Nameless Order within the Great Wall - just as it is about to be beset by giant, lizard-like monsters. As wave after wave of attacks and surprise tactics batter the Wall, Europeans and Chinese battle hordes of the creatures in a series of escalating conflicts leading to a final confrontation with the alien queen. Fantasy adventure, starring Matt Damon, Willem Dafoe and Tian Jing

programme.title: Bone Tomahawk
programme.desc: After an outlaw unknowingly leads a band of cannibalistic cave-dwellers into the peaceful town of Bright Hope, the elderly sheriff rounds up a posse to rescue townsfolk abducted by the ferocious tribesmen. Western horror, starring Kurt Russell and Patrick Wilson

programme.title: In Fear
programme.desc: A couple go to Ireland for a music festival, but get hopelessly lost when driving through a series of country roads. Their plight turns deadly as they are terrorised by mysterious figures lurking in the darkness, while an encounter with a seemingly harmless local brings dangers of its own. Horror, starring Iain De Caestecker, Alice Englert and Allen Leech

programme.title: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water
programme.desc: The cheery sea creature tries to prevent a precious secret formula from falling into the wrong hands - but when it goes missing, the end of the world approaches. SpongeBob and his friends embark on a quest to get it back, which leads to them developing superpowers and venturing onto dry land. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny and Antonio Banderas

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain
programme.desc: Thanks to his race car driver owner, golden retriever Enzo learns that the techniques needed on the racetrack can also be used to successfully navigate the journey of life. Comedy drama, starring Milo Ventimiglia and Amanda Seyfried

programme.title: River of No Return
programme.desc: A homesteader and his son fall foul of a crooked gambler, who makes off with the farmers horse and rifle and leaves behind his abandoned girlfriend. However, the three of them are forced to flee by river on a raft when their farm comes under attack. Western, starring Robert Mitchum, Marilyn Monroe and Rory Calhoun

programme.title: Romancing the Stone
programme.desc: A romantic novelist goes in search of her kidnapped sister in the steamy jungles of South America, only to become the target of a villainous general who demands as a ransom the valuable treasure map in her possession. Help is at hand in the form of a craggy daredevil fortune hunter, who has his eye on a share of the profits. Comedy adventure, starring Michael Douglas, Kathleen Turner and Danny DeVito

programme.title: Home Alone
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine OHara and John Candy

programme.title: A Man Called Otto
programme.desc: A man whos given up on life following the loss of his wife and wants to end it all. When a young family moves in nearby, he meets his match in quick-witted Marisol, leading to a friendship that will turn his world around. Comedy drama, starring Tom Hanks, Mariana Trevino and Rachel Keller

programme.title: Military Wives
programme.desc: With their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the centre of a media sensation and global movement. As unexpected bonds of friendship flourish, music and laughter transform their lives, helping them to overcome their fears for their loved ones in combat. Comedy drama, starring Kristin Scott Thomas, Sharon Horgan and Emma Lowndes

programme.title: The Future
programme.desc: A carefree couple prepare to adopt a stray cat, but realise this means they face being responsible for another creature for years to come. With the animal due to arrive in a month, they set out to have as many new experiences as they can in the time left, with unexpected repercussions for their relationship. Drama, directed by and starring Miranda July. With Hamish Linklater

programme.title: The Unforgiven
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger stirs up trouble for a Texas ranching family by revealing that their adopted daughter was actually kidnapped from a Kiowa Native American tribe as a child. While the other farmers turn their backs on the family, and the Kiowa prepare to lay siege to their home, the three sons are forced to decide where they stand. Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Audie Murphy, Doug McClure and Audrey Hepburn

programme.desc: A determined marshal tracks down a murderous gang to a hostile town, where he encounters resistance from every quarter while trying to bring the fugitives to justice. Michael Winners Western, starring Burt Lancaster, Robert Duvall, Lee J Cobb, Robert Ryan and Sheree North

programme.title: Shane
programme.desc: A mysterious gunfighter intervenes when a man and his family are threatened by a predatory cattle baron determined to force every homesteader in the valley off the land. The situation rapidly escalates into violence, while an unspoken attraction develops between the gunman and the settlers wife. Western, starring Alan Ladd, Jack Palance, Van Heflin and Jean Arthur. Based on the novel by Jack Schaefer

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: Bomber commander Buzz Rickson is respected by his crew for his daredevil abilities in the air, but his personal life is a disaster. His co-pilot initially idolises the fearless airman, but over time becomes increasingly aware of his heros flaws - especially when Rickson starts pursuing his comrades girlfriend. Second World War drama, starring Steve McQueen, Robert Wagner and Shirley Anne Field.

programme.desc: Josh goes after an elephant trainer who used the animal to scare away the townspeople, leaving him free to commit a robbery. Steve McQueen stars

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspected kidnapping and gets his first lead when a ransom note is discovered. The missing woman then turns up dead at the wheel of a crashed car, smelling of alcohol. Whodunit, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective applies his professional know-how to a fatal shooting, and soon begins to suspect that the dead mans brother-in-law may know more about the case than he is letting on - a theory borne out by forensic tests on the murder weapon. Jack Shepherd stars as the dour detective, with Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth is called to Gossington Hall by her old friend Dolly Bantry (Joanna Lumley) when she finds the corpse of an unknown blonde in the library of her home. It soon transpires that there is no shortage of suspects, including local bad boy Basil Blake (Ben Miller) and Dollys husband Arthur (James Fox), but when the victim is identified as a dancer in line to inherit a fortune, enquiries take a different turn. Crime drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Simon Callow, Jack Davenport and Tara Fitzgerald

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: During a music masterclass led by a renowned pianist, a shy prodigy suffers a panic attack and runs off to a nearby river. To her horror, she witnesses a woman drowning and a baby left on the riverbank. But when Barnaby arrives, there is no sign of the victim - and he is struck by similarities to another mysterious case that happened 20 years ago at the same spot. Guest starring veteran actor James Fox and Coronation Streets Ian Puleston-Davies (Owen Armstrong), alongside former Corrie star Richard Fleeshman (Craig Harris)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local boxer John Kinsellas successful world title bid stirs up hidden passions among the residents of Midsomer Morchard. As plans to stage a celebratory re-enactment of a Victorian prizefight shape up, jealousy, betrayal and blackmail take a ringside seat, while two suspicious deaths suggest Barnaby has let friendship cloud his judgement. Detective drama, guest starring Phil Daniels (Quadrophenia, EastEnders), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute leads to murder after a stalwart in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe as Barnaby and Jones investigate. Guest starring Hugo Speer (Bleak House), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Anglers flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake. Their peace is ruined however when hundreds of sporting enthusiasts descend on the area for the Psycho Mud Run. Following the bitterness, fishing hooks and barbs are discovered hidden within the race obstacles before someone is found fatally electrocuted. Barnaby is left working out whether his death was another part of a sabotage gone wrong. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The unorthodox but brilliant North East detective investigates when charred human remains are found in an abattoir furnace, and attempts to deduce how and why they got there in the first place. The bones are identified as belonging to a fellow cop, leading Vera to uncover a web of dark secrets as she looks into her dead colleagues fraud squad. Brenda Blethyn dons her familiar hat and mac to play Vera in this mystery, based on the characters created by Ann Cleeves

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The inspector and his sidekick DS Hathaway investigate the murder of a talented maths student. The prime suspect is the victims ex-boyfriend, who is convinced his uncle has set him up, but old case papers belonging to Morse reveal the boys family is hiding a dark secret. Laurence Fox and Rebecca Front co-star alongside Kevin Whately

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell report on two more cases. More than 40 years ago, Caroline Kinsey was pregnant, alone and unable to provide the kind of family and upbringing she believed all children deserved. Burdened by her heart-breaking decision to give her son up for adoption, Caroline longs to find him, to hear that he did have a happy childhood, and to know whether he can forgive her after all these years. Raised as an only child, Paul McFarlanes beloved mother died when he was nine, but years later, a single piece of paper threw all his assumptions about his small family into question

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Two grieving widows lay rival claims to a corpse found washed up on the beach, each insisting it is the body of her missing husband. programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Oxfords last-surviving all-female college is holding a reunion to bid farewell to one of its most prominent professors. However, the evening leads to tragedy when a guest is found murdered, and Lewis is convinced the killing is connected to an attack that occurred at the same institution 10 years previously. The detective calls in his former DS, Alison McLennan, to help with the investigation, but the case takes a twist when two more bodies turn up. Crime drama, guest starring Juliet Stevenson and Saskia Reeves, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The residents celebrate Christmas 1919 with a lavish party, but tensions are rife and Batess arrest casts a shadow over the festivities. Mary has to consider her future with Sir Richard Carlisle following a disagreement at a shoot and Violet has concerns about Rosamund, whose new suitor - the dashing but raffish Lord Hepworth - is not all he seems. One-off festive special of the hit costume drama, guest starring Nigel Havers and Sharon Small, with Brendan Coyle, Michelle Dockery, Iain Glen, Maggie Smith and Samantha Bond

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Oscar-winning actress Shirley MacLaine joins the cast of the period drama as Coras mother Martha, who makes a grand entrance when she arrives at Downton for Matthew and Marys wedding. However, with the couple struggling to stay united as their big day looms, will Marthas Atlantic crossing have been for nothing? Meanwhile, Mr Carson runs the rule over new footman Alfred, and Robert receives news that could leave him facing the greatest crisis of his life - and plunge the rest of the household into chaos. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, Jim Carter and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: With the estates future hanging in the balance, Mary hopes to receive a bailout from her grandmother Martha - and with Violets help, tries to make sure Downton puts on a bigger show than ever before with a grand party for friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes hears worrying news, and OBriens efforts to boost Alfreds progress meets with disapproval from Thomas. Costume drama, starring Michelle Dockery, Shirley MacLaine and Maggie Smith

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Ediths big day finally arrives, but will her enthusiasm convince the family that Strallans age doesnt matter? Meanwhile, Mrs Hughes anxiously awaits her results, Anna makes a breakthrough to help Bates, and Mary takes matters into her own hands to secure the estates future - but the personal cost could be high. Costume drama, starring Laura Carmichael, Robert Bathurst, Phyllis Logan, Joanne Froggatt and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Bransons political views land him in trouble and Sybils loyalty is tested to the limit, while Ethel makes a difficult decision about her sons future. Anna wonders what is causing Bates silence, and Carson begins recruiting a footman, with promising candidate Jimmy (Ed Speleers, Eragon) sparking immediate interest below stairs. Costume drama, starring Allen Leech, Jessica Brown Findlay, Amy Nuttall, Joanne Froggatt, Brendan Coyle and Jim Carter

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: A series of scandals makes for an interesting few days in the quiet village of St Mary Mead, and most seem to revolve around a blustering local colonel, whose brusque manner and short temper make him unpopular with his fellow villagers. When he is found dead with a bullet through the head, Miss Marple and the reluctant DI Slack investigate. Whodunit, starring Geraldine McEwan as Miss Marple, with Jane Asher, Jason Flemying, Derek Jacobi and Miriam Margolyes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the death of a racehorse trainer and suspect an aristocratic familys troubled history holds the key to the mystery - until a second killing makes them think again. Groom Jake Foley seems the obvious suspect, but as events unfold, the detectives inquiries gradually focus instead on the residents of stately Bantling Hall. Detective drama, starring John Nettles

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a seemingly beloved resident of a coastal community is fatally driven off the road, and realises she has to dig up the victims past to have any chance of unmasking the killer. Joined by her faithful team, including DC Kenny Lockhart and new recruit DC Jac Williams, Vera attempts to find the missing link that will crack the case, but finds it difficult to get to the truth when everyone they encounter seems to be protecting a secret. Crime drama based on Ann Cleeves series of novels, starring Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: The Hack
programme.desc: Investigative journalist Nick Davies receives an anonymous tip-off regarding Rupert Murdochs News of the World. Following the trail, he discovers damning evidence that proves phone hacking at the paper was not the work of one rogue reporter, as has been claimed for years but was endemic. Nick and his long-time editor and friend Alan Rusbridger decide to risk their careers and their newspaper to go up against one of the most powerful media organisations in the world. Drama, starring David Tennant and Toby Jones

programme.title: The Hack
programme.desc: DCS Dave Cook is assigned to investigate the unsolved murder of private detective Daniel Morgan, the most investigated homicide in the history of the Metropolitan Police. As he is drawn deeper into the case, Dave finds himself under surveillance by the News of the World. When his private and work lives are put under pressure, Dave begins to pursue the case ruthlessly and takes up matters with Rebekah Wade, the News of the Worlds powerful editor

programme.desc: The heroes in a half shell come to terms with their new roles as saviours of New York City in an animated series set shortly after the events chronicled in the film Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem. Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.sub-title: The Best of Both Worlds - Part Two

Sci-fi adventure, starring Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes and Brent Spiner

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard returns to his roots in France as he recuperates from his ordeal at the hands of the Borg, Wesley Crusher receives a hologram message from his dead father, and Worf tries to cope with a visit from his non-Klingon parents

programme.title: The Reluctant Royal
programme.desc: A working class mechanic discovers his estranged father is a duke who wants him to take up the title. While he is reluctant to take up the position, he finds himself attracted to the advisor assigned to change his mind. Romantic comedy, starring Andrew W Walker and Emilie de Ravin

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David Attenborough employs the latest technologies to explore the violence, rivalries and deadly weaponry existing within the world of bugs. This first episode examines the survival tactics of its terrifying residents including killer ants, trap-setting spiders and beetles with the ability to shoot boiling chemicals at their enemies

programme.title: Micro Monsters with David Attenborough
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues his bug-eyed view of the world of creepy-crawlies, revealing how predators defuse the defences of their prey. Highlights include the cockroach wasp, busy preparing a tasty - and very live - treat for its young, the whirligig beetle, which employs a water-based radar system, and the jumping portia spider, which feeds on other arachnids

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: Following his visit to the Great Barrier Reef in 1957, naturalist and broadcaster David Attenborough returns and uses the latest filming techniques to unlock the secrets of the natural wonder. In the first edition, he descends beneath the waves at night and uses cutting-edge technology to generate computer scans of the sea floor. He also learns about a complex community of animals, as well as the annual coral spawning, which is responsible for the great diversity in the reef

programme.title: Age of the Big Cats
programme.desc: The stories of the puma and the leopard, following their evolution and adaptation through the Ice Age and unravelling a story that spans two million years of history

programme.title: Agatha Raisin
programme.sub-title: The Wizard of Evesham - Part Two

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi heads to Cornwall to help Sean and Janine, the owners of Northshore, Budes only hostel. Having returned from travelling the world, the pair bought the property to keep their travelling dream alive. Running the hostel is the best job Seans ever had - but a shocking downturn in occupancy and their unorthodox living scenario have left Janine wanting out. Desperate to sort the business, the couple call on Alexs advice in a last-ditch attempt to resolve matters. The expert arrives with a few surprises up her sleeve, but quickly learns saving this business isnt going to be easy

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector

Though Paolo is now back, profits are nowhere to be seen, so Alex tries to turn things around

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Actress Anna Maxwell Martin researches her family tree. Travelling to the small town in Northern Ireland where her father grew up, her understanding of her grandparents - who suffered a heartbreaking family tragedy - is turned on its head. On her mothers side, Anna starts with her grandfather Maxwell, whose name she added to her own to create her stage name. Looking into his childhood, she uncovers a dark history of domestic abuse and family separation. However, she also discovers extraordinary familial solidarity and love that changed the pattern for the generations that followed

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Medical doctors, science broadcasters and identical twins Chris and Xand van Tulleken team up to research their family tree. They grew up surrounded by old paintings and documents commemorating characters from their Dutch ancestry, but despite this wealth of family archive, the twins know little about their heritage. Their journey takes them back to the Netherlands, where they look into the career of sea captain Jan Tulleken, their four-times great-grandfather, a staunch royalist who joined the Dutch navy at 13. But as they trace the story back, they reveal a troubling story

programme.title: Long Lost Family

The team also meets Francesca Barnes, who is in the early stages of transitioning from male to female. She was born with the name Paul and given up for adoption as a baby. Francesca is now searching for her mother, Norma, but fears her transition may prove too much of a challenge, and lead to rejection

During his recovery, he falls for a nurse - but their romance is beset by obstacles. Fact-based romantic drama, starring Chris ODonnell, Sandra Bullock and MacKenzie Astin. programme.title: Wild West: Americas Great Frontier
programme.desc: Wildlife in Americas mountain regions, including the Rockies and the Sierra Nevada, areas infamous for extremes of temperature from freezing winters to scorching summers. The programme examines the survival strategies employed by animals including black bears, pikas and bison, as well as parasitic plants. Plus, a look at the challenges faced by these regions human inhabitants, including ranchers leading their cattle on 70-mile journeys

programme.title: Big Cats 24/7
programme.desc: The annual flood arrives in the Okavango Delta, bringing new prey and challenges for the big cats. Gordon Buchanan follows the hungry lion mothers as they hunt buffalo, while eldest cub Mathata learns to avoid this formidable prey. Anna Dimitriadis tracks a skinny young cheetah struggling to catch food in the changing landscape and Brad Bestelink follows a pregnant leopard looking for a den as rising flood waters push dangerous males into her territory

programme.title: The Future of Nature
programme.desc: Glimpse into grasslands where the biggest animal numbers are found, and see how animal life helps to draw down carbon

programme.title: The Americas

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow

He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: Home Rescue: The Big Fix
programme.desc: The team help to declutter Margaret Pierce and her son Shanes fourth-floor apartment in Scholarstown, Co Dublin that is overwhelmed with clutter. programme.desc: A crooked antiques dealer masquerading as a clergyman encounters a farmer - who gives him a piece of furniture worth a fortune. Starring John Gielgud and Bernard Miles

programme.desc: A scorned husband seeks revenge on his wife and her lover - but is not certain who the man is. Starring Denholm Elliott and Joss Ackland

programme.title: Tales of the Unexpected
programme.desc: A womans eye transplant leads her lover to see her in a new light. Starring Amanda Redman and Anthony Valentine

programme.desc: A man discovers that his business partner has fraudulently embezzled at least $60,000 from their company, and warns him that if he does not repay the money promptly, criminal charges will be pressed that should result in a lengthy prison sentence. However, his crooked former friend already plans to fake his death and escape with the cash. Drama, starring Richard Anderson, Steven Hill and Joanna Moore

programme.title: The Alfred Hitchcock Hour
programme.desc: A married man finds his beautiful mistress murdered and flees without reporting the crime and soon becomes the victim of a blackmailer. Dark drama, starring Patrick ONeal and Kathie Brown

programme.title: Hitchcock on Grierson
programme.desc: Alfred Hitchcocks 1970 profile in which he pays tribute to pioneering documentary-maker John Grierson, exploring what made his work so extraordinary and influential

However, he left the band to study art in Hamburg, and ultimately died of a brain haemorrhage before they became famous. Part of the Liverpool on the Box week

programme.title: The Stones in Exile
programme.desc: Alan Yentob visits France to introduce a film documenting the recording of the Rolling Stones 1972 album Exile on Main Street. Having faced ruin due to the size of their unpaid tax bills, the Stones relocated to the French Riviera to make the album, before completing the recording in Los Angeles - with Mick Jagger also finding time to get married in St Tropez. Alongside rare home-movie footage of the band at work, there are also interviews with Jagger, Keith Richards, Bill Wyman and Charlie Watts

programme.desc: Music critics examine the life and career of the Canadian singer-songwriter, who was a driving force behind some of the biggest groups of the 60s before finding success on his own

programme.title: Amy
programme.desc: Documentary portrait of soul, jazz and RnB singer-songwriter Amy Winehouse, whose untimely death in July 2011 followed a well-publicised history of drugs and alcohol abuse. Director Asif Kapadia traces Amys rise and demise over the 13 years preceding her death, telling her story via her music and autobiographical song lyrics, video footage shot by friends and family, archive television clips, plus voiceover interviews with those who were personally and professionally close to her. Contributors include Pete Doherty, Mitch Winehouse, Tony Bennett, Mark Ronson and Tyler James

programme.desc: The Penningtons, owners of Muncaster Castle in the Lake District, discuss the challenges of housing three generations of their family under one roof, while elderly patriarch Patrick struggles to find new purpose following the death of his wife.
